page.title: 11Vanishing Hedgerows
page.content: A Cornish Hedge is about one and a half metres tall.The sides and top are made out of stone and it is filled with earth with grass and plants growing on the top,so it makes a good habitat for animals.They are mostly on narrow lanes so the flail mowers cut them so that the holidaymakers don't have any accidents.The plants in the hedgerows are dying off very quickly because the flowers are cut before they seed,it is also destroying the animals and birds homes.10 years ago the people,from the Cornish Naturalist Trust chose a mile of hedgerow and counted how many differnt species were living in it. There were 150 differnt plants and 28 differnt birds.Now in the same mile of hedgerow there are only 61 plants, 35 of which are threatened and only 2 different species of nesting bird.
